meanings.definition: The amount that a tin can hold.
meanings.sent1: I bought two tinfuls of cookies for the party.
meanings.sent2: She poured three tinfuls of water into the pot.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added ten tinfuls of salt to the soup!
meanings.sent4: His heart was filled with tinfuls of joy when he saw his family.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was overflowing with tinfuls of gold coins.

meanings.sent1: The shelves were stocked with tinfuls of candies.
meanings.sent2: They collected many tinfuls of seashells on the beach.
meanings.sent3: The kids traded tinfuls of marbles during recess.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room in tinfuls.
meanings.sent5: The garden was blooming with tinfuls of colorful flowers.
